verses.text: 哀歌以色列家啊！要聽這話，就是我為你們唱的輓歌：

words.note: A sorrowful song, often for the dead.
A song of mourning, often for the dead.

verses.text: 「童貞女以色列，跌倒了，不能再起來；她被拋棄在自己的地上，沒有人扶她起來。」

words.note: Lit. 'child-chaste woman'.

verses.text: 因為主耶和華論以色列家這樣說：「這城派兵一千，剩下的只有一百；出兵一百，只剩下十個。」
尋求主得以存活耶和華對以色列家這樣說：「尋求我，就必存活；

words.definition: so as to be able to

verses.text: 不要去伯特利尋求我，不要去吉甲，也不要過去別是巴。因為吉甲必被擄掠，伯特利必化為烏有。」

words.note: Lit. 'black nothing'; implies complete destruction or non-existence.

verses.text: 尋求耶和華，就必存活，免得他像火在約瑟家猛烈蔓延，吞滅他們；沒有人能把伯特利的火撲滅。

words.note: Precedes object of a verb, indicating action on it.

verses.text: 他們使公正變為苦堇，把公義棄於地上。

words.note: A bitter plant often used metaphorically in the Bible.
Precedes object of a verb, indicating action on it.
Combines verb 'abandon' with classical preposition 'on/at'.

verses.text: 那創造昴星和參星，把幽暗變為黎明，把白日轉為黑夜；又吩咐海水，把海水倒在地上的；耶和華就是他的名。

words.note: Precedes object of a verb, indicating action on it.
Precedes object of a verb, indicating action on it.
Precedes object of a verb, indicating action on it.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding clause, 'the one who...'

verses.text: 是他使毀滅像閃電臨到堡壘，使毀滅臨到堅固的城。

words.note: Used for emphasis, 'It is he who...'
Connects an adjective to a noun, like '-ly' or '-ous'.

verses.text: 他們討厭那在城門口主持公道的人，恨惡說正直話的。

words.note: Refers to a person or people described by the following phrase.

words.definition: city gate, gate of the city

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from preceding clause, e.g., 'the one who...'
Forms a noun phrase from preceding clause, e.g., 'those who speak...'

verses.text: 你們欺壓窮人，強徵他們的五穀；因此，你們用琢磨過的石頭建造房屋，卻不能住在其中；你們栽種美好的葡萄園，卻不能喝園中的酒。

words.note: Refers to the five main grains of ancient China, or generally cereals.

verses.text: 因為我知道你們的過犯眾多，罪大惡極；你們迫害義人，收受賄賂，在城門口屈枉窮乏人；

words.note: An idiom describing extreme wickedness.
City gates were often places for justice and commerce in ancient times.

verses.text: 為此，聰明人在這時代緘默無聲，因這時代邪惡。

words.note: An idiom emphasizing complete silence.

verses.text: 你們要尋求良善，不要尋求邪惡，這樣才可以存活。耶和華萬軍的 神就必與你們同在，正如你們所說的。

words.note: Often used in the title 'Lord of Hosts' (耶和華萬軍之神).
Capitalized for the monotheistic God.
Forms a nominal phrase 'that which is said'.

verses.text: 你們要喜愛良善，恨惡邪惡，在城門口伸張正義；這樣，耶和華萬軍的 神或會恩待約瑟的餘民。
因此，主耶和華萬軍的 神這樣說：「各廣場充滿哀慟的聲音，街上只聽見『苦啊！苦啊！』的喊聲；人要召農夫來哀哭，召善於哭喪的人來哀喊。

words.note: Often used in 'Lord of hosts'
An exclamation of sorrow or pain.
An exclamation of sorrow or pain.
Often indicates purpose, 'to do something'
Refers to professional mourners in ancient times.
Often indicates purpose, 'to do something'

verses.text: 所有葡萄園充滿哀慟的聲音，因為我必在你們中間經過。」這是耶和華說的。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from the preceding verb.

verses.text: 渴望耶和華日子來臨的人，你們有禍了！耶和華的日子對你們有甚麼好處呢？那日是黑暗，沒有光明的日子。

words.note: A common biblical idiom expressing lament or curse.

verses.text: 那日就像一個人避過了獅子，卻遇上了熊；回到家裡，手靠在牆上，卻被蛇咬。
耶和華的日子不是黑暗，沒有光明，只有幽暗，全無光輝嗎？
神不喜歡外表的敬虔我憎恨、厭惡你們的節期，也不喜愛你們的節日。

words.note: Refers to the God of the Bible
Often used in religious contexts for reverence towards God.
Refers to religious festivals or appointed times.

verses.text: 雖然你們給我獻上燔祭和素祭，我卻不接受。你們獻上肥美的牲畜作平安祭，我也不悅納。

words.note: Refers to presenting offerings or sacrifices.
Describes livestock as well-fed and suitable for sacrifice.
Specifically means to accept something favorably.

verses.text: 你們唱歌的吵聲要遠離我，我不想聽見你們的琴聲。

words.note: Here indicates a command or strong desire.

verses.text: 但願公正好像潮水滾流，公義好像河水長流。

words.note: Expresses a strong wish or hope.
Often refers to divine justice and righteousness.

verses.text: 以色列家啊！你們在曠野四十年，有獻燔祭和素祭給我嗎？

words.note: Refers to the nation or descendants of Israel.
Used to express exclamation or address.

verses.text: 你們抬著你們的神「撒固」王，和你們的星神「迦溫」的神像，就是你們為自己所做的。

words.note: A pagan deity, also known as Moloch or Rephan.
A pagan star deity, also known as Chiun or Rephan.
Often preceding a verb to form a passive or nominalized phrase.

verses.text: 我必使你們被擄，流亡到大馬士革以外。這是耶和華說的，萬軍的 神就是他的名。

words.note: The proper name of God in the Old Testament.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'that which was said by'.
Part of the title 'LORD of hosts'.
Here used as a title for the Almighty God.
